issue.title: Lanczos3 vs Magic Kernel Sharp 2013

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: This issue is about a new feature rather than a bug.

issue.body:
100% Plugin UI are beautiful, but when resized it becomes a bit lackluster even with lanczos3.


As described in http://www.johncostella.com/magic/ as "Sharp 2013" kernel.

Sharp 2013

issue.title: Add musical time to TimeInfo, support tempo change

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: This issue is about a new feature rather than a bug.

issue.body:
It would be good to have a parameter on `TimeInfo` which gives access to the DAW's elapsed musical time. I'm thinking something like JUCE's `AudioPlayHead::PositionInfo.getPpqPosition()`.

At the moment it is possible (albeit rather fiddly) to reconstruct the musical position from the current sample rate, `TimeInfo.tempo` and `TimeInfo.timeInSamples`, however there are a couple of problems with this approach:

1. If there is any tempo automation *before* the current playhead position, there is no way to figure out the current musical position as the tempo change will have scrambled the relationship between samples & beats/bars. You can still calculate musical time relative to when the user hit play, but not the absolute song position of the playhead.
2. On Reaper at least, there is vari-speed control for the whole project which does some weird thing where it misreports the sample rate to make everything run slower/faster. This is a great feature but it breaks my plugin & a couple of others I've used. Having a musical time parameter would fix this.
3. It makes the logic for any kind of sequencer much cleaner, particularly if the sequencer is expected to follow tempo.

I believe this is a cross-platform feature as the JUCE docs don't mention any caveats about what hosts it works in. I'd be willing to take a look at raising a PR if you don't have time for this, but I'm quite a n00b with D 😅 

BTW absolutely loving Dplug so far, thank you for giving the people a better way of writing plugins!

issue.title: Status of some layout constraints when not owned
issue.body:
- [x] can LAYOUT_BORDER pixel be changed?  **yes**
         - when not owned too? **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it keeps the constraint**

 - [x] can LAYOUT_TRAILING pixels be changed?  **yes**
         - when not owned too? **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it keeps the constraint**

 - [x] can LAYOUT_MULTIPLICITY pixel be changed? **yes**
         - when not owned too? => **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it removes the constraint** because subrect

 - [x] can bytes between scanlines in LAYOUT_SCANLINE_ALIGNED be changed? **yes**
         - when not owned too? => **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it removes the constraint** because subrect

 - [x] is LAYOUT_GAPLESS preserved by subrect => **it removes the constraint**

commits.message:
Specify layout constraint in more detail, including regarding read/write and ownership.
Before converting with convertTo, "adhoc" constraints are generated from the Image, to see if some constraints are accidentally followed.
This can create way less conversions when just loading an image, since many decoders are gapless and straight vertical.

issue.title: Possibility for onMouseClick to consume the click event, but not initiate dragging.

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: This issue is about a new feature rather than a bug.

issue.body:
For now:
- returning `false` from `onMouseClick` does not consume the event
- returning `true` from `onMouseClick` always initiate dragging

Need a third way that says "consume the event, but do not initiate dragging.
Dragging effect is: 
- lock mouse to the window
- transform onMouseMove into onMouseDrag
- delay calling onMouseExit until dragging is terminated (mouse is released)

comment.body: Done in v13

payload.description: Audio mixer and playback library like SDL_mixer but without dependencies.

commits.message: Add PlayOptions.startTimeSecs, this is implemented by decoding up to that point in the stream.
Add missing synchronization for playing sounds, add way to trigger synchronized samples.

BREAKING Add ability to decode a source compeltely before playing it.

New IAudioSource calls:
    bool fullDecode();        // Note: disallowed after playing it.
    bool hasKnownLength();    // Guaranteed to be true if fullDecode() returned true.
    int lengthInFrames();     // -1 if !hasKnownLength
    double lengthInSeconds(); // -1.0 if !hasKnownLength

Hide those calls:
    prepareToPlay();
    mixIntoBuffer();

New calls in IAudioSource:
    originalLengthInFrames()  // the original length in frames, in terms of original samplerate
    sampleRate()              // the original samplerate
A simple producer/consumer when finished decoding.

issue.title: Add musical time to TimeInfo, support tempo change

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: This issue is about a new feature rather than a bug.

issue.body:
It would be good to have a parameter on `TimeInfo` which gives access to the DAW's elapsed musical time. I'm thinking something like JUCE's `AudioPlayHead::PositionInfo.getPpqPosition()`.

At the moment it is possible (albeit rather fiddly) to reconstruct the musical position from the current sample rate, `TimeInfo.tempo` and `TimeInfo.timeInSamples`, however there are a couple of problems with this approach:

1. If there is any tempo automation *before* the current playhead position, there is no way to figure out the current musical position as the tempo change will have scrambled the relationship between samples & beats/bars. You can still calculate musical time relative to when the user hit play, but not the absolute song position of the playhead.
2. On Reaper at least, there is vari-speed control for the whole project which does some weird thing where it misreports the sample rate to make everything run slower/faster. This is a great feature but it breaks my plugin & a couple of others I've used. Having a musical time parameter would fix this.
3. It makes the logic for any kind of sequencer much cleaner, particularly if the sequencer is expected to follow tempo.

I believe this is a cross-platform feature as the JUCE docs don't mention any caveats about what hosts it works in. I'd be willing to take a look at raising a PR if you don't have time for this, but I'm quite a n00b with D 😅 

BTW absolutely loving Dplug so far, thank you for giving the people a better way of writing plugins!

issue.title: Status of some layout constraints when not owned
issue.body:
- [x] can LAYOUT_BORDER pixel be changed?  **yes**
         - when not owned too? **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it keeps the constraint**

 - [x] can LAYOUT_TRAILING pixels be changed?  **yes**
         - when not owned too? **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it keeps the constraint**

 - [x] can LAYOUT_MULTIPLICITY pixel be changed? **yes**
         - when not owned too? => **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it removes the constraint** because subrect

 - [x] can bytes between scanlines in LAYOUT_SCANLINE_ALIGNED be changed? **yes**
         - when not owned too? => **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it removes the constraint** because subrect

 - [x] is LAYOUT_GAPLESS preserved by subrect => **it removes the constraint**

commits.message:
Specify layout constraint in more detail, including regarding read/write and ownership.
Before converting with convertTo, "adhoc" constraints are generated from the Image, to see if some constraints are accidentally followed.
This can create way less conversions when just loading an image, since many decoders are gapless and straight vertical.

issue.title: Possibility for onMouseClick to consume the click event, but not initiate dragging.

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: This issue is about a new feature rather than a bug.

issue.body:
For now:
- returning `false` from `onMouseClick` does not consume the event
- returning `true` from `onMouseClick` always initiate dragging

Need a third way that says "consume the event, but do not initiate dragging.
Dragging effect is: 
- lock mouse to the window
- transform onMouseMove into onMouseDrag
- delay calling onMouseExit until dragging is terminated (mouse is released)

comment.body: Done in v13

payload.description: Audio mixer and playback library like SDL_mixer but without dependencies.

commits.message:
Channels have their own volume.

Final volume is: master volume x channel volume x source play volume.
Channel volume is smoothed linearly and can change over time.
Its smoothing is a MixerOptions.

payload.description: Audio mixer and playback library like SDL_mixer but without dependencies.

commits.message: Add PlayOptions.startTimeSecs, this is implemented by decoding up to that point in the stream.
Add missing synchronization for playing sounds, add way to trigger synchronized samples.

BREAKING Add ability to decode a source compeltely before playing it.

New IAudioSource calls:
    bool fullDecode();        // Note: disallowed after playing it.
    bool hasKnownLength();    // Guaranteed to be true if fullDecode() returned true.
    int lengthInFrames();     // -1 if !hasKnownLength
    double lengthInSeconds(); // -1.0 if !hasKnownLength

Hide those calls:
    prepareToPlay();
    mixIntoBuffer();

New calls in IAudioSource:
    originalLengthInFrames()  // the original length in frames, in terms of original samplerate
    sampleRate()              // the original samplerate
A simple producer/consumer when finished decoding.

100% Plugin UI are beautiful, but when resized it becomes a bit lackluster even with lanczos3.


As described in http://www.johncostella.com/magic/ as "Sharp 2013" kernel.
Is sharper than any lanczos. A bit better with small text, perhaps a bit less "3D". Perhaps a bit too much sharpening going on.

issue.title: Add musical time to TimeInfo, support tempo change

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: This issue is about a new feature rather than a bug.

issue.body:
It would be good to have a parameter on `TimeInfo` which gives access to the DAW's elapsed musical time. I'm thinking something like JUCE's `AudioPlayHead::PositionInfo.getPpqPosition()`.

At the moment it is possible (albeit rather fiddly) to reconstruct the musical position from the current sample rate, `TimeInfo.tempo` and `TimeInfo.timeInSamples`, however there are a couple of problems with this approach:

1. If there is any tempo automation *before* the current playhead position, there is no way to figure out the current musical position as the tempo change will have scrambled the relationship between samples & beats/bars. You can still calculate musical time relative to when the user hit play, but not the absolute song position of the playhead.
2. On Reaper at least, there is vari-speed control for the whole project which does some weird thing where it misreports the sample rate to make everything run slower/faster. This is a great feature but it breaks my plugin & a couple of others I've used. Having a musical time parameter would fix this.
3. It makes the logic for any kind of sequencer much cleaner, particularly if the sequencer is expected to follow tempo.

I believe this is a cross-platform feature as the JUCE docs don't mention any caveats about what hosts it works in. I'd be willing to take a look at raising a PR if you don't have time for this, but I'm quite a n00b with D 😅 

BTW absolutely loving Dplug so far, thank you for giving the people a better way of writing plugins!

issue.title: Status of some layout constraints when not owned
issue.body:
- [x] can LAYOUT_BORDER pixel be changed?  **yes**
         - when not owned too? **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it keeps the constraint**

 - [x] can LAYOUT_TRAILING pixels be changed?  **yes**
         - when not owned too? **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it keeps the constraint**

 - [x] can LAYOUT_MULTIPLICITY pixel be changed? **yes**
         - when not owned too? => **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it removes the constraint** because subrect

 - [x] can bytes between scanlines in LAYOUT_SCANLINE_ALIGNED be changed? **yes**
         - when not owned too? => **no**
         - what does the subrect operation does to the constraint? => **it removes the constraint** because subrect

 - [x] is LAYOUT_GAPLESS preserved by subrect => **it removes the constraint**

commits.message:
Specify layout constraint in more detail, including regarding read/write and ownership.
Before converting with convertTo, "adhoc" constraints are generated from the Image, to see if some constraints are accidentally followed.
This can create way less conversions when just loading an image, since many decoders are gapless and straight vertical.

issue.title: Possibility for onMouseClick to consume the click event, but not initiate dragging.

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: This issue is about a new feature rather than a bug.

issue.body:
For now:
- returning `false` from `onMouseClick` does not consume the event
- returning `true` from `onMouseClick` always initiate dragging

Need a third way that says "consume the event, but do not initiate dragging.
Dragging effect is: 
- lock mouse to the window
- transform onMouseMove into onMouseDrag
- delay calling onMouseExit until dragging is terminated (mouse is released)

comment.body: Done in v13

payload.description: Audio mixer and playback library like SDL_mixer but without dependencies.

commits.message:
Channels have their own volume.

Final volume is: master volume x channel volume x source play volume.
Channel volume is smoothed linearly and can change over time.
Its smoothing is a MixerOptions.

payload.description: Audio mixer and playback library like SDL_mixer but without dependencies.

commits.message: Add PlayOptions.startTimeSecs, this is implemented by decoding up to that point in the stream.
Add missing synchronization for playing sounds, add way to trigger synchronized samples.

BREAKING Add ability to decode a source compeltely before playing it.

New IAudioSource calls:
    bool fullDecode();        // Note: disallowed after playing it.
    bool hasKnownLength();    // Guaranteed to be true if fullDecode() returned true.
    int lengthInFrames();     // -1 if !hasKnownLength
    double lengthInSeconds(); // -1.0 if !hasKnownLength

Hide those calls:
    prepareToPlay();
    mixIntoBuffer();

New calls in IAudioSource:
    originalLengthInFrames()  // the original length in frames, in terms of original samplerate
    sampleRate()              // the original samplerate
A simple producer/consumer when finished decoding.
